jtxt.emulator

Class Region

  • java.lang.Object
    • jtxt.emulator.Region

  • public class Region
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a region within the terminal in terms of a start and end location. This class encapsulates these Locations, as well as providing utilities for constructing, testing, and modifying these regions.
    See Also:
    Location

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Location end
      The lower-right bound for the region this text is contained in.
      Location start
      The upper-left bound for the region this text is contained in.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Region

        public Region(Location start,
              Location end)
        Constructs a Region with the given start and end Locations.
        Parameters:
        start - The upper-right Location for the region.
        end - The lower-left Location for the region.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the start position is greater than the end position or if the start line is greater than the end line.

      • Region

        public Region(int startLine,
              int startPosition,
              int endLine,
              int endPosition)
        Constructs a new region for the given lines and positions.
        Parameters:
        startLine - The upper-left line of the region.
        startPosition - The upper-left position of the region.
        endLine - The lower-right line of the region.
        endPosition - The lower-right position of the region.

    • Method Detail

      • inside

        public boolean inside(Region other)
        Determines whether this region is within the given region.
        Parameters:
        other - The region that possibly encompasses this one.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this region is within the other.

      • fromLocation

        public static Region fromLocation(Location start,
                                  int width,
                                  int height)
        Creates a new Region from the given start position, determining the end Location from the width and height.
        Parameters:
        start - The upper-left location of this region.
        width - The width of this region.
        height - The height of this region.
        Returns:
        A new region which starts at the given location, and which will have the width and height that are specified.
